term.title: soft-segment phase domain

item.text: Phase domain of microscopic or smaller size, usually in a block, graft, or segmented copolymer, comprising essentially those segments of the polymer that have glass transition temperatures lower than the temperature of use.

notes.item: Soft-segment phase domains are often larger than hard-segment phase domains and are often continuous.

sources.item: PAC, 2004, 76, 1985. 'Definition of terms related to polymer blends, composites, and multiphase polymeric materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2004)' on page 2002 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200476111985)
